Lilium Digital Garden

How to set up Lilium

  1. Create your digital garden
  2. Pusblish your digital garden

Create your digital garden

If you already have Jekyll on your pc, all you have to do is make a copy of Lilium template reposiory from GitHub and use it to create a new website.

To make a copy of the repository I suggest you to â€œforkâ€ mine, so you can find the Lilium template in your GitHub account.

In this image you can see my repositoryâ€™s. Yours will be similar but intead of â€œcrixer18/giardinoâ€ there will be your user name and the name of the repository which contains the template.

From there you can clone the repository on your pc using terminal.

In your case, the link in red will be the one you copied from GitHub repository (previous image). The string in blue is the name of the new folder youâ€™re going to create, in which the template will be downloaded.

At this point, youâ€™ve created the site. You can enter the directory (with $cd my-digital-garden or whatever is the name you chose), and test the Jekyll site on localhost:

Then:

Watch the result: open localhost:4000 in your browser.

It was easy, wasnâ€™t it?
